home.name: Lucila V. Kendziur
home.resume: Hi! I'm Lu, a front-end developer from Argentina. I greatly enjoy developing user interfaces that are accessible to all users. I love being able to learn and share my knowledge with the team. Teamwork, code documentation, and accessibility are three things that are very important to me.
home.card-description-1: Besides being a programmer, I hold a Bachelor's degree in Political Science from the National University of Rosario.
home.card-description-2: I started my career in systems accidentally at the University when, in a group project, I was the Functional Analyst.
home.card-description-3: I really love cats, and I have two of them. I also enjoy practicing trekking and working in large teams.

about.title: About
about.description: I started in the world of software development in 2021 as a NetSuite Developer, which allowed me to build a very strong foundation in vanilla JavaScript and gain a deep understanding of the client-server relationship. In mid-2022, I transitioned to working as a Frontend Developer, creating user-friendly and accessible user interfaces. As a developer, I take pride in ensuring the quality of the delivered code, documentation, and the well-being of the team.

project.title: Projects
project.description: This section showcases a selection of my notable projects. Each project represents a unique opportunity for me to apply my skills and creativity to solve real-world problems. From web development to data analysis, these projects demonstrate my ability to collaborate, think critically, and deliver high-quality results. Explore the projects below to get a better understanding of my capabilities and the value I can bring to future endeavors.
